title: Redfall Disappoints, Dune 2 Trailer Breakdown, & More! | IGN The Weekly Fix
description:
Wanna catch up on all the gaming and entertainment news highlights from the past week? From Redfall releasing as a disappointment to anticipated fans, to our breakdown of the trailer for Dune: Part 2, tune in for the Weekly Fix - the only show packed with the recommended weekly dose of gaming, entertainment, and esports news!

00:00 - Intro
00:36 - Redfall Might Be the Biggest Disappointment of 2023
03:57 - PS5 Sales Surge While Xbox Hardware Falls
05:43 - Xbox Looks to Course-Correct with Starfield Direct, Games Showcase
08:20 - Star Wars Jedi: Survivor on PC Gets Important Performance Patch
11:11 - CMA Says Nintendo Platforms Aren't 'Technically Capable' of Running Call of Duty
13:09 - More Surprising Action Coming In Dune: Part Two
15:44 - Twisted Metal TV Show Arrives This July, First Teaser Released
20:34 - Alita- Battle Angel 2 Conversations Are Happening

#IGN #Gaming #Entertainment

title: Why Won’t Xbox’s Big Game Problem Go Away?
description:
With the disappointing launch of Redfall, Xbox Series X's big Arkane exclusive, Xbox continues to under-deliver where it matters most: video game exclusives. Why does this keep happening to Xbox and who, if anyone, is to blame?

#IGN #Gaming #Xbox

title: Non-Violent Fortnite Is Now the Dumbest Olympic eSport - IGN Daily Fix
description:
In today's Daily Fix:
The International Olympic Committee has announced a new addition to their eSports lineup: Fortnite. No, it's not quite what you think. In a recent earnings call, WB Discovery revealed that Hogwarts Legacy hit a major milestone: $1 billion in sales. In other Hogwarts Legacy news, a new patch is live that lets you do to the in-game spiders what Potter and Friends did to those boggarts in Prof. Lupin's closet (basically turn them into something really silly). And Riot Games has reached a settlement in a discrimination lawsuit, and it's going to cost them a decent chunk of change.

#IGN #Fortnite
